item.title: Comment on “Embrace it and Go for it!” – with Dr. Steve G. Jones by Sabrina Truscott
item.dc:creator: Sabrina Truscott
item.description: Hi Denis and Welcome! Thanks for the kind worlds. And it's great that you not only set your intention but that you declared it here. People sometimes miss how powerful that can be. YOUR life on YOUR terms. Great! :)
item.content:encoded: Hi Denis and Welcome! Thanks for the kind worlds. And it’s great that you not only set your intention but that you declared it here. People sometimes miss how powerful that can be. YOUR life on YOUR terms. Great! ðŸ™‚

item.title: Comment on “Embrace it and Go for it!” – with Dr. Steve G. Jones by denis
item.dc:creator: denis
item.description: Sabrina, thank you for what you do, sharing your gifts!! I discovered you in the middle of last night while watching a video from my main man, Carl Harvey. Fantastic content! Looking forward to growing in the community. I really enjoy how you weave humor into your interviews. I have put out my intention to start an online business this year, and say "bye bye 9-5" once and for all, then truly live MY life on MY terms.
item.content:encoded: Sabrina, thank you for what you do, sharing your gifts!! I discovered you in the middle of last night while watching a video from my main man, Carl Harvey. Fantastic content! Looking forward to growing in the community. I really enjoy how you weave humor into your interviews. I have put out my intention to start an online business this year, and say “bye bye 9-5” once and for all, then truly live MY life on MY terms.

item.title: Comment on How To Overcome Your Fear of Public Speaking by Prince Mao
item.dc:creator: Prince Mao
item.description: it's very important being oneself as you rightly put it . No one was born with it but learning and practice brings eloquent presentation- i also agreed with you.
item.content:encoded: it’s very important being oneself as you rightly put it . No one was born with it but learning and practice brings eloquent presentation- i also agreed with you.

item.title: Comment on How To Overcome Your Fear of Public Speaking by Virginia Reeves
item.dc:creator: Virginia Reeves
item.description: Good reminders and techniques. Thanks Lisa. I agree that when you are comfortable with your message and material the nervous factor is reduced a lot. You know you can handle any 'problem' and keep moving forward. Had to smile at not thinking of the audience in their undies. That would distract me in an awful way !
item.content:encoded: Good reminders and techniques. Thanks Lisa. I agree that when you are comfortable with your message and material the nervous factor is reduced a lot. You know you can handle any ‘problem’ and keep moving forward. Had to smile at not thinking of the audience in their undies. That would distract me in an awful way !

item.title: Comment on “How Do I Figure Out What I Really Want?” by Sabrina Truscott
item.dc:creator: Sabrina Truscott
item.description: Hi Karyn! Thank you so much for taking a moment to share your heart and journey with us. :) And that book sounds great. I'm going to add it to my ever-growing "to be read" list. Thanks!
item.content:encoded: Hi Karyn! Thank you so much for taking a moment to share your heart and journey with us. ðŸ™‚ And that book sounds great. I’m going to add it to my ever-growing “to be read” list. Thanks!

item.title: Comment on “How Do I Figure Out What I Really Want?” by Karyn Fountaine
item.dc:creator: Karyn Fountaine
item.description: Beautiful job Sabrina! I have a lovely friend who taught me all of this back in 1996 (read The Power of Oneness by Sandra Brossman Bezar). I completely manifested a new life and a new career. Now I am 60 and facing some physical challenges. And, it is time to manifest something new and different. The challenge has been clarifying what it is that I really want. So, back to the drawing board. It is time to meditate and create some "vision" statements! Thanks for your bright and refreshing perspective! You are perfectly Right On with what you are communicating! I am sharing your information with my son and some other dear friends who are ready to manifest something new and beautiful in their lives! I am looking forward to "finding my passion" once again! Bless you!
item.content:encoded:
Beautiful job Sabrina! I have a lovely friend who taught me all of this back in 1996 (read The Power of Oneness by Sandra Brossman Bezar). I completely manifested a new life and a new career. Now I am 60 and facing some physical challenges. And, it is time to manifest something new and different. The challenge has been clarifying what it is that I really want.
So, back to the drawing board. It is time to meditate and create some “vision” statements!
Thanks for your bright and refreshing perspective! You are perfectly Right On with what you are communicating!
I am sharing your information with my son and some other dear friends who are ready to manifest something new and beautiful in their lives!
I am looking forward to “finding my passion” once again!
Bless you!

item.title: Comment on How To Look Great in Photos by Rosa Muziotti
item.dc:creator: Rosa Muziotti
item.description: Thank you. I understood why some photos are nicer than others. By the way, photographer only show your natural beauty because your photos are not "photoshopped", are they?
item.content:encoded: Thank you. I understood why some photos are nicer than others. By the way, photographer only show your natural beauty because your photos are not “photoshopped”, are they?

item.title: Comment on How To Look Great in Photos by Sabrina Truscott
item.dc:creator: Sabrina Truscott
item.description: Hi Tina! Yes, people get tripped up by this ESPECIALLY when they are watching themselves on the screen. If you're looking at the screen instead of the camera, people think you come off as shifty cause you're not meeting their eyes.
item.content:encoded: Hi Tina! Yes, people get tripped up by this ESPECIALLY when they are watching themselves on the screen. If you’re looking at the screen instead of the camera, people think you come off as shifty cause you’re not meeting their eyes.
